Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; faint traces of dot and billet band in added colour above two added white bands; below, faint trace of lotus bud in white outline with added red centre; exterior: at rim, band of diagonal strokes above Z band between dilute lines; reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (noted in Gardner's plate)
Curator's comments: Cook and Woodhead show British Museum 1924,1201.846, 1924,1201.728 and 1924,1201.584 together as if they were joined together. The sherd joins British Museum 1924.1201.728 and 1924,1201.584.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 64, p. 169, no. 193, pl. 34, no. 15)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 63, no. 742, pl. XXI, no. 742)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1953) (phase 2)
